DOC.detailed_description: Quality improvement ( QI ) increasingly important element deliver health care . Learning feel confident use QI method essential part healthcare practice . eLearning cost effective way capacity build large cohort health care professional service user . National Institute Health Research Collaboration Leadership Health Research Care Northwest London develop suite eLearning module ( QI4U ) support introductory understand technical aspect QI . This protocol describe trial evaluate experience learning , knowledge gain , change behaviour , impact eLearning QI method . Participants belong one three Groups learner course 12 month : learner use QI4U ( group 1 ) ; people use facilitate learning ( Group 2 ) ; learner use combination QI4U facilitate learning ( Group 3 ) . The Kirkpatrick model use evaluate learning . The primary outcome interest transfer knowledge gain learn clinical practice service improvement individual ( level 3 ) . Secondary outcome include reaction experience QI4U , knowledge gain , result impact learn QI4U service improvement ( level 1 , 2 4 ) . Transfer knowledge clinical practice assess interview individual learner . Experience eLearning knowledge gain assessed use feedback form , questionnaire , time spend QI4U reflective log . Impact assess interview organisational lead high prevalence QI4U learner . This study provide evidence effectiveness use eLearning mean learn QI . It serve evaluate learner ' experience use eLearning impact various train method within context learning QI .
